searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptioncallback	Function	false The function to call when the timer ends. duration	number	true	0	The duration of the timer in milliseconds. _init	boolean	true	true	Starts the timer and sets up the callback to be called when the timer ends. key	string	true	randomKey	The unique key for this timer.

searchDocs.title: duration​
searchDocs.content: The duration of the timer in milliseconds.  Type: number

searchDocs.title: key​
searchDocs.content: The unique key for this timer.  Type: string

searchDocs.title: isStarted​
searchDocs.content: A boolean indicating whether the timer has started.  Type: boolean

searchDocs.title: startedAt​
searchDocs.content: The timestamp when the timer was started.  Type: number

searchDocs.title: _init​
searchDocs.content: Starts the timer and sets up the callback to be called when the timer ends.  Type: boolean

searchDocs.title: _init()​
searchDocs.content: Starts the timer and sets up the callback to be called when the timer ends.  Returns: Timer | false

searchDocs.title: kill()​
searchDocs.content: Stops the timer and removes it from the Map.  Returns: boolean

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionduration	number	false Time measured in milliseconds. useMili	boolean	true	false	Return duration with milliseconds or not.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Array<string>

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: duration(60100); // [ '1 Min' ] duration(60100, true); // [ '1 Min', '100 ms' ]

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionurl	RequestInfo	false A string representing the URL for fetching. options	RequestInit	true	{ }	Options for the HTTP(S) request. timeout	number	true	5000	Time measured in milliseconds.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Promise<Response>

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: fetchWithTimeout("https://google.com/", {}, 2000); // Promise<Response>

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionstr	string	false The string to uppercase first character.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: string

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: var str = "hello world"; console.log(firstUpperCase(str)); // "Hello world" console.log(str); // "hello world"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionbytes	number	false The byte value to convert.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: string

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: getBytes(2048); // "2.00 KB"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value whose memory usage is to be estimated. This can be an Object, string, number, boolean, or an Array.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: string

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: getMemory("John"); // "8.00 Bytes" getMemory(12); // "8.00 Bytes" getMemory(true); // "4.00 Bytes" getMemory(["John", 12]); // "16.00 Bytes" getMemory({ name: "John", age: 12 }); // "16.00 Bytes"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionhex	string	false The hexadecimal string to convert.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: number

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: hexToInt("ffffff"); // 16777215 hexToInt("#ffffff"); // 16777215

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionduration	number	false Time measured in milliseconds.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: string

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: formatTimeMs(60100); // "00:01:01" formatTimeMs(1000 * 60 * 80 * 24); // "24:00:00"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionint	number	false The integer to convert.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: string

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: intToHex(16777215); // "#ffffff"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionhex	string	false The hexadecimal string to convert.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Object { r: number, g: number, b: number }

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: hexToRgb("ffffff"); // { r: 255, g: 255, b: 255 } hexToRgb("#ffffff"); // { r: 255, g: 255, b: 255 }

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isArray(16777215); // false isArray([1, 2, 3]); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isBoolean(16777215); // false isBoolean(1 == 2); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isFunction(16777215); // false isFunction(() => { console.log("hello world!"); }); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isNumber(16777215); // true isNumber("Hello"); // false

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isObject(16777215); // false isObject({ name: "John" }); // true isObject([1, 2, 3]); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isNull(16777215); // false isNull(null); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isUrl("discord.com"); // false isUrl("https://discord.com"); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isPromise(16777215); // false isPromise(new Promise(() => {})); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isString(16777215); // false isString("John"); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionvalue	any	false The value to check.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: boolean

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: isUndefined(16777215); // false isUndefined(undefined); // true

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionlength	number	false The length of the random string to generate.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: number

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: randomKey(6); // "E61jC0"

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	DescriptionpartialValue	number	false The partial value. totalVlue	number	false The total value.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: number

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: percentage(5, 10); // 50

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	DescriptiondirName	string	false The directory to read files from. options	Object	true An object with optional parameters. options.extensions	Array<string>	true	[ ]	An array of file extensions to filter the files by. If not provided, all files are read. options.noPromise	boolean	true	false	A boolean indicating whether to return the result directly or wrapped in a Promise. If true, the result is returned directly. If false or not provided, the result is wrapped in a Promise.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Array<string>

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: readFiles(`${process.cwd()}/src`, { noPromise: true }); // [ "./src/functions/duration.js", "./src/functions/fetchWithTimeout.js", "./src/typings/duration.d.ts", "./src/typings/fetchWithTimeout.d.ts" ] readFiles(`${process.cwd()}/src`, { extensions: [".js"], noPromise: true }); // [ "./src/functions/duration.js", "./src/functions/fetchWithTimeout.js" ]   ./ ├───src | ├───functions | | ├───duration.js | | └───fetchWithTimeout.js | └───typings | ├───duration.d.ts | └───fetchWithTimeout.d.ts

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionms	number	false The duration to wait, in milliseconds.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Promise<void>

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: await wait(5000); // wait for 5 secs

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionmin	number	false The lower bound of the range. This value is inclusive. max	number	false The upper bound of the range. This value is exclusive.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: number

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: randomInt(1, 10); // 2

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Parameter	Type	Optional	Default	Descriptionarray	Array	false The array to shuffle.

searchDocs.title: Returns​
searchDocs.content: Array

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: shuffle([1, 2, 3]); // [2, 1, 3] shuffle(["John", 12, "USA"]); // ["USA", "12", "John"]

searchDocs.title: What you'll need​
searchDocs.content: Node.js version 16.0 or above: When installing Node.js, you are recommended to check all checkboxes related to dependencies.

searchDocs.title: Install​
searchDocs.content: # via npm $ npm install @khaidev1012/funcs --save # via yarn $ yarn add @khaidev1012/funcs   You can type this command into Command Prompt, Powershell, Terminal, or any other integrated terminal of your code editor.  The command also installs all necessary dependencies you need to run @khaidev1012/funcs.  Thats All!  Simply declare the library using the syntax and you can start using our library right away!

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: // via ESM import * as funcs from "@khaidev1012/funcs"; // via CJS const funcs = require("@khaidev1012/funcs"); // Example Usage console.log(funcs.getBytes(2048)); // '2.00 KB'
